title: I‚Äôm disappointed
text:
I know people may not have a problem with this but my google is being annoying right now. So usually when I would search up images, it would show some other images once I click on it. Then I have the option to save and that. Now every single time I click on a picture, it sends me to the website on where it‚Äôs from. I don‚Äôt want the website, I just wanna see the picture and save it on my camera roll. Now it‚Äôs annoying how long it takes me save an image. I‚Äôm always seeing the website with its picture. I sometimes like the other photos under that image I search up. I sometimes wanna save them. Now? it takes me at least two-four minutes just to save a picture. 

I just want my old google back :(

title: Create and take home your one-of-a kind treasure
text: Art Beachside is truly a ‚Äúdon‚Äôt miss‚Äù activity for the entire family!  Make an appoint and sign up for a class or two (or three!) or just walk in. You will often find volunteers to teach and help with suggestions for your personal piece of art work. Art Beachside is an open, spacious, calm, peaceful, and creative environment.  All of the supplies you need are available and plentiful.   June, the owner and visionary for this studio, is absolutely passionate to ‚Äú grow artists‚Äù within the community of Ponce Inlet and surrounding areas. Even if you‚Äôve never tried to create a piece of art, you‚Äôll be amazed at what you can do!  You will also find gorgeous pieces of unique art for purchase

title: Overall solid app but few annoying things...
text:
Google is my go-to app throughout the day to quickly look up and research stuff. BUT two things are annoying....  for one, Google seems to remove re-add functions like the translate drawer at the bottom which is really helpful but recently disappeared for a long time before it got added back in ‚Äî WHY??
The more annoying thing is that every time I leave the app to check something else in my phone sands come back, it reloads the feed! And I have background refresh disabled! Often I'm still seeing articles I want to read but have to go to another app in between and when I come back, they're gone and feed is refreshed. STUPID!!!!
The app should leave it up to the user and the user only to decide WHEN to refresh... hence: only 3 stars üôÑ

title: Some Major Problems with the 3-D
text: There‚Äôs a huge problem that I‚Äôm having with the 3-D Bengal Cat. The problem is when I attempt to videotape it in 3-D, I will try to move the animal around as I‚Äôm taking the video. It shows that it works, as the red line is moving around the circle, however the video does not actually take. I have seen a couple times at the top of my screen ‚ÄúTouch to return to Snapchat‚Äù or ‚ÄúHangouts‚Äù but even after I have closed these apps it still fails to work and says the same thing. Afterwards when I try to take a video without moving the animal, it doesn‚Äôt take either! I have to close and open the app again, or exit out of 3-D in order to get a working video. But I‚Äôm still unable to move the animal around or the whole process will repeat. I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs the same for other animals or not, but regardless, please fix this!

title: Hacked
text: Google was okay from the start. But it never gave a clear answer and it has lots of horrible websites. I was researching about hamster care, i asked for how long they live and the best cage and all that, google always gave me these random websites that don‚Äôt have all the information i need. So i asked what kind of food hamsters should eat and what‚Äôs healthy for them, and once again google found all the websites. And i click on one, then i get a warning that my phone has been hacked, and there would be no way to stop it from happening. This wasn‚Äôt the first time. My sister got the same warning searching about her fandom, but i didn‚Äôt think it would happen again. Google please clear all these fake websites. Getting hacked it very dangerous, and most people have personal their information on their devices, even if they are older than 17.

title: Google lens gone??!!
text: I am only giving one star until google ‚Äúlens‚Äù is back in search bar next to microphone again. What happened to the google lens option that WAS right next to the microphone in the search bar?? I used it for only a couple of things and when I went to use it again within 24 hours it was GONE. I‚Äôve gone through everything within the app and there‚Äôs a place to download it and that didn‚Äôt even work. In one place it talks about the lens but again, it‚Äôs not on there. I‚Äôve uninstalled the app and when I go back to the App Store to reinstall it, it says to update it. But I uninstalled it so why is it only giving option to update it instead of install it. And when I go to App Store and look at all the app offers, it shows that you can use google lens to search stuff you see, BUT IT‚ÄôS NOT THERE WHEN I‚ÄôM IN THE APP ITSELF. What‚Äôs the deal google? Where is the lens????? Please help me with this??!!!!

title: Akstyles
text:
The only search engine I trust and has been my go to since the conception of the term. I‚Äôm really loving the personalized news feeds. As someone who intentionally avoids today‚Äôs unreliable news sources, especially from social media apps, the google news feed has been a welcome addition to my routine. I no longer have to miss out on reading articles I may be interested in because of my choice to not login to FB. Instead I often find articles I‚Äôm interested in through my google feed in between searching for things. 
Google Search is one of my top 5 most used apps. Their reliability and commitment to being the best in my opinion has hands down beat any other apps. I‚Äôm sticking with google for the long haul.

title: New update AWFUL. Google image search useless.
text: New google image search is TERRIBLE! The sole reason I search for images is to see IMAGES, and only images. I do not want to see the text, or a ton of white space. I liked how the old google search app showed images only. I purposely used this app when searching for images as chrome doesn‚Äôt display image searches the same. Chrome shows the text. But now, not only is the text required but am unable go full screen with an image (and hide the text when tapping on it or rotating my phone). This is awful for viewing images because phone screens are not that big and now it only shows up on half the screen. Please bring back the old version or at least make it an option  that is easy to select on the screen (not hidden in layers of menus within settings). This is extremely frustrating and disappointing

title: Losing pages.
text:
If I‚Äôm on a page and I have to either step away so my phone goes to sleep or switch screens, it resets to the homepage search bar. Not all the time, but enough that it‚Äôs incredibly irritating. I‚Äôll have to scroll all the way back down to where I was (I love reading comments on articles, so sometimes  it‚Äôs a lot of scrolling) to continue reading. This has only become a problem in the last few updates, I believe since the overall look has changed. Sometimes the page I was on will be completely gone from the history as well, saying I have no browsing history when I clearly do, as I was JUST reading something. Then I have to remember what I searched and the title of the article.

Apps are supposed to be streamlined, quick & beneficial. I might as well read on a computer. Fix this, please.

title: No variety. Too Mainstream.
text: There‚Äôs nothing wrong with it‚Äôs UI or anything, it‚Äôs actually simple to use. But if you‚Äôre trying to do actual research or look for something you better hope it‚Äôs mainstream or trendy otherwise you‚Äôre gonna be looking a LONG time. It‚Äôs like its search results are based off words you put in the search bar, and whatever happens to be popular in society. I tied looking for a scene from something I liked and no matter how much I changed my wording in the search bar all of my results were either the same songs they‚Äôd give over and over or tik tok trends, even though my search bar mentions NOTHING about music, songs, or tik tok(?). And the cherry on top? I found what I was looking for on Yahoo in a couple searches. All I got from this whole experience is it needs a sort of ‚ÄúThese results aren‚Äôt helpful‚Äù option rather than ‚Äúfeedback‚Äù nobody at google ever is gonna read.

title: Getting worse and worse
text: Clearly Google has become more interested in monetizing what was once the sine qua non of digital maps than they are in providing a good user experience. They have junked it up with SO MUCH garbage, like (paid?) eateries and shops, that you can hardly see the streets. And no, I do not need a huge marker to tell me I ‚Äúrecently visited‚Äù a site that I merely tapped at random to get rid of something else obstructing my view. At the same time, so my street names are missing, unless you finally just happen to enlarge or shrink the map the perfect amount, and even then it will vanish if you move. And I‚Äôm talking about major thoroughfares, bridges, and so on. Then there‚Äôs all the persistent stuff I don‚Äôt want, like the weather, the Live icon, an inset photo, and info at the bottom of the map about whatever you looked up. Switching to another map!!

title: Dentists of Tucson
text: Let me start by saying Dr Stears and his assistant did a wonderful job on my new crown. I also got a chance to see and hug Lynette, favorite hygienist, she is awesome. Very professional staff, always smiling and welcoming. Items are explained and you are aware of your portion of the payment necessary to do procedure. Business manager handled an irate patient professionally and I commend her for being calm but stern. Please remember to be kind, the people are simple doing their job, which they do an exceptional job. I work in the medical field and understand the difficulty of insurance companies and explaining the remaining balances and it is difficult. I love this staff and will continue to come here and recommend this office to everyone!

title: Unsatisfied
text:
Google quickly became the most used search engine thanks to its simplicity and ease of use. Sadly, this app is missing a few things to earn those describers. 

1. They took away the connectivity to Apple Maps. Why? This was one of the main features I used the app for. I would look up Applebee‚Äôs, click for directions, and google would reroute me right to Apple Maps with the right directions. Now Apple Maps is no longer an option and it‚Äôs obvious you took away this feature without stating that‚Äôs what you were going to do in the update which in my mind is a really shady business practice and let‚Äôs me know you knew doing this would make some people mad. 

2. Symbols on the images. Now users can‚Äôt screenshot or view images without seeing the buttons/symbols. Again, another feature I used a lot that was taken away. 

3. When you click on a suggested image when viewing an image, they is no way to go back to that original image without going back all the image results. Why is there no back button?

Please add back these features to earn a good review! Thanks to these exact features, I think I‚Äôm going to have to start using Safari app just for the Apple connectivity and to view images without the three or four buttons on top each of them.

title: Bad.
text: The update made to this killed it. I can‚Äôt understand why this change was made. After clicking onto a website if I want to go to another I have to fully leave the site because clicking the top just copies the link. Why was this made a thing? Did whoever suggest it have a hard time copying the link somehow so they made such a stupid change? Another problem is that whenever I close my phone because I can‚Äôt keep the screen open forever especially because I have work to do it closes the entire site I was on. Meaning if I was on a site that had pages then to it or anything like that I would have to constantly start from the very beginning whenever I reopen my phone because the site was closed. Everything was way better before and I can‚Äôt understand who was stupid enough to suggest this changes or who was even dumber to even approve of these.

title: Why. Just why?
text:
Let me say that google will always be my go to web browser.
My problem is that you guys went back to a feature that makes this app unusable. You once again have made the decision to not allow me to edit a url. And went back to where you have to swipe down to get rid of a website. But it only makes searching more frustrating than it should be. I keep accidentally getting rid of a article or page because when swiping up to go to the top of the page, it gets rid of it. And you also can‚Äôt go back to that because you decided to go back to where you have to tap on the backwards button to go back to a previous page, instead of just holding the button and being allowed simply select the page you want to be on. Plz fix these problems

title: The Interface is Getting Cluttered
text: It was nice having the streamlined layout of the app several versions before, and with every update version, the interface loads up with more buttons of questionable interest, and an excess of information that would be best left hidden or condensed. The tab feature is also getting cluttered with excessive numbers of saved pages after simple searches. I do not need a new window every time I want to view a new image, I just want to browse in peace. This is a petty and personal issue that doesn‚Äôt impede the app‚Äôs usefulness, so I will leave this with a decent rating, but I would greatly appreciate it if options for less screen filler were available in future updates. Thanks to whoever may see this.

title: Good as Expected but...
text: This app basically does exactly what you‚Äôd think a Google app would do. For that reason, it‚Äôs a fine app. I deleted this app though because I didn‚Äôt see the advantage of keeping it when I could just use a mobile browser to search on Google. I wouldn‚Äôt even think twice about downloading this app again if it incorporated just 1 specific thing... the first is that I wish this app had a reverse image search feature similar to Pinterest‚Äôs. Google already has a reverse image search option for non-mobile users (PC, Mac, etc.) in the browser, but the Google app doesn‚Äôt have this function for mobile use. So I would think that a reverse image search right on your mobile device would be brilliant. I would probably delete my Pinterest app if the Google app had this function.

title: Google window on the bottom of screen
text: I like using this app, however, I really dislike the google window at the bottom of the page. It‚Äôs in the way when I need to make a selection at the bottom of the screen. I know how to make it smaller so I can make a selection. It‚Äôs just to much work just to see the bottom of the screen. Most times I just give up and click open page in Safari so I don‚Äôt have deal with it. Its also slightly annoying because it never goes away and I don‚Äôt see an option to close it. The only time it goes away is when I scroll up which does me no good if I want to look at the very bottom of the page. It would be much better if it was hidden at the top of the screen and I can just swipe down if I want to see it. At least give an option to close the box.

title: Almost got a virus! (Think I actually have)
text:
So I thought that this Kahoot bot website was really funny so I clicked the link‚Ä¶ yeah, bad mistake.
It started to give me pop up ads that were really unnecessary and some of them were not even related with the topic. It told me I needed a vpn for the website. And oh no.. then a littoral, PHYSICAL pop up came up on my iPad saying, ‚Äú(19) Viruses have been activated on your apple device! Please install this vpn or your photos and other social media things will be stolen and sold!‚Äù I got very scared and my instinct hit the install button. And my mind was like, AHHHHHHHH NOOOOOOOOO!!! JAGSHDBEGUS üíÄ just so y‚Äôall know this happened like 15-20 mins ago. Yeah but regardless of all that the app is astonishing! Just so you know please remove the website. It is the first search when you put in ‚ÄúKahoot bot‚Äù

title: Ok, Here‚Äôs my answer..-
text:
The ‚ÄúHum for song‚Äù thing is Not worthless, it help a lot with others, or does not..- But sometimes it doesn‚Äôt work, and I think google is a special app for all of us! We have to treat it right, and (you don‚Äôt have to agree!-) I think google can show us how many things happened or we ask questions!! Maps is with google, games are with google, FaceTime is with google, ads are with google, Half of everything is google!! title: Chelsea Bynum McKellum -Restland employee who helped us.
text: Restland was the place we chooses for our end distiny. We meet Chelsea when our siste Marisa was laid on that certain area of Restland. That‚Äôs where we meet Chelsea. After that time we Capasgordo‚Äôs planned to get some place for us . Chelsea was the who accommodated us . She showed and explained to us ,ask questions regarding the different plan we need. At the end we got 4 lots and services that we need. She was a happy and reliable person and goes beyond what we are expecting. We really want to recommend her as one assets of your company. Thank you so much Chelsea and hoping that you still can help others as what you did to us. God Bless Always .

title: Cannot change payment method for YT premium
text:
I subscribed to YT premium some time ago which has been fine, and just discovered that PayPal now charges for processing the monthly YT automatic deduction.  I‚Äôve emailed Google asking about it but no reply.  I‚Äôve been trying to change my payment method away from PP and just discovered that Google no longer allows changes via IOS devices - one must use a PC.  Absolutely ridiculous approach to business!  Who cares what vehicle is used??  

So now I have to pay a PP fee on top of my monthly bill.  I don‚Äôt have access to a PC unless I want to risk using one at a library.  A former PP executive is now with Google to leverage payment systems so the fee still ends up at Google.  

So that premium account you have and pay w/PP?  Add a couple bucks on top of it each month so the two entities can increase their revenue.

title: Just keeps getting worse and worse.
text: App can‚Äôt load search results about 40% of the time. Everything else works fine, I have no problem doing anything else on my phone just this app won‚Äôt load search results it says try again. If I click one of the news articles under the search bar it‚Äôs absolutely fine, just can‚Äôt load search results. And this is when I‚Äôm home with full wifi in nyc with full service. Again, literally everything else on my phone is fine.  I use google a lot, but if I search five things I‚Äôll have to go to internet explorer for at least 2-3 of them because the google app just won‚Äôt load search results. I‚Äôve tried taking off the app and reloading it, I‚Äôve had this problem on two different phones now. It‚Äôs just not a good app anymore if it doesn‚Äôt give search results about half the time.

title: Special Friend
text: 93 y/o Mom needed 24/7 care after breaking a hip, and Home Instead stepped up to the challenge. They sent reliable, nice, trustworthy people that knew how to care for someone in her position. They worked with us to whittle down the staff as she needed less help. We ended up with the nicest most caring person, Fannie. She has become part of the family and been so good to our mom. She is always in a cheerful mood and loves taking out mom out on adventures (doctors and then a fun lunch ü§£) This makes all the difference in the world to how our mom feels. We try to be there when we can, but when we can‚Äôt, we know Fannie is there. Great working with her and Home Instead

title: Once critical app now unstable under iOS12
text:
I have used this app since its early days, a majority of my experience was excellent: on an iPad Pro, it was a godsend in split-screen mode when I needed to pull content from several sources into my primary apps by dragging or pasting.

Once iOS updated to its current release, this is the least stable and highest-lag of Google‚Äôs iOS offerings (several of which also suffer under iOS12). 

I didn‚Äôt understand when the ‚Äòtools‚Äô option was suddenly deactivated on image searches, but tolerated it because the app overall was still strong.

Now, I use this app only when I can afford to have it freeze or crash. Scrolling through saved item collections is impossibly laggy, with several seconds elapsing between a touch or drag and the app responding ‚Äî when it does scroll, it stutters and freezes.

I have a top-tier current-gen iPad Pro with 70% of internal storage available, and would hope Google values stability and performance over feature-adds that aren‚Äôt ready for public release.

Please fix this, Google: an app that is fragile and unreliable is an app uninstalled. I‚Äôve invested in the enterprise products you offer and rely on them daily (if not hourly) to do my job.

title: Open Tabs (IPhone XR)
text:
Saw someone else post something similar, but I can‚Äôt open or delete any of my past google tabs. If I create a new tab, then I can go to all tabs and delete/select it, but any tab that I don‚Äôt immediately delete is no longer accessible to me. I can still access favorited tabs, but the same problem happens.
Essentially it‚Äôs this - I open one tab, it‚Äôs fine - I open another tab which is fine, now the first one is inaccessible - I open another tab, which works fine, but the previous two are now inaccessible -etc, on and on. 
This problem also happens when I leave the google app for a while, or swipe up. Because whenever I do that, returning to google then brings me back to the home screen of google, meaning that the previously fine tab is now inaccessible cause I (technically?) opened a new tab, even if this new tab doesn‚Äôt show up, but still causes the same problem.

title: Has been my favorite app but has been crashing for weeks now
text:
This app has been my favorite iPhone app but a recent update led to constant consistent crashing issues. Any time I try to use it it crashes. This began to occur after an update. I have looked ever day for an update assuming the developers would want to repair a problem that leads to complete inability to use app, but nothing. 
I have begun to look into other search apps as the lack of any response is concerning. I have not yet found one I like as much, but honestly ANYTHING that works is wayyy better than typing in a search getting result only to have the app ALWAYS crash. When trying to get the result.  Gave three stars because of the very slow response, but would have given 4/5 stars before this problem which renders the app useless.

title: Link to maps usually fails
text:
Generally a useful app but Google has lots of bugs to fix!  A search often brings up a map, and when I click on the map within the Google app, it gives "no results".  Very annoying and obviously wrong, since if you open another map app, including Google maps, there is what you were looking for.  Google, fix this!

Similar issue with other searches like yelp.  If you search for an establishment and the result you click is a yelp website, the Google app doesn't take you to the information you want.  Instead you get a series of links and you have to reenter the search on the yelp app. There's obviously a better way, and things could be more seamless.

These have been long running problems and I'm surprised Google isn't on top of this.  Seems like it should have been relatively easy to fix.

title: Good App, only one problem
text: I‚Äôve been getting this pop up lately on Google and Google Chrome that basically says ‚ÄúCongratulations, you have been selected...‚Äù and all that. It‚Äôs a scam. It‚Äôs really consistent and it won‚Äôt go away even after clearing my cookies on my phone. It doesn‚Äôt happen on Safari and only on Google products on my phone. I tried deleting the app and I even reset my phone and nothing has worked. One way you can improve is to add a feature to Google that stops frequent pop ups like that because this is getting out of hand. That‚Äôs the only problem I have with it, everything else is fine. And trust me, it‚Äôs not just me who is dealing with all of this. I hope this will be solved soon.

title: Very disappointed
text: Okay Google, you‚Äôve been on thin ice for a while but with this new update is where I draw the line. I loved the Google app and have been using it religiously as my search engine for 5+ years. There have been many changes since I first started using the app, mostly good, but some bad. I use google a lot for reference images for art and now you can no longer save pictures directly from images. It was bad enough you took away the image previews, and then changed the way you save photos, but now you can‚Äôt even save them! It sends you to the website, but for many things on mobile it either doesn‚Äôt work or forces you to sign into a website to get to the photo. Sometimes it will take you to a website that just doesn‚Äôt even work! I will probably stop using the Google app after today and switch to another unless you fix this. It makes the app unusable for me.

title: Services NOT received (NYT subscription) and no way to dispute
text: I‚Äôve been trying to contact google in every way shape or form in order to get them to refund me my money, but there is no Avenue.  Zero.  They don‚Äôt give any way for you to directly email someone so that you can resolve your issue and don‚Äôt give any phone to call.  A New York Times news subscription is pretty basic and it seems like I should‚Äôve been able to troubleshoot why I wasn‚Äôt receiving service. I spoke to the New York Times x2 and both times they said it was a third-party (Google Pay issue). The fact that I can‚Äôt contact them directly it‚Äôs really bad. The account information that I received in my email doesn‚Äôt work when I enter it into their form. Don‚Äôt trust this app! There‚Äôs no way you can get your money back because there‚Äôs no way to contact anyone if you have an issue.

title: I‚Äôm over it!
text: For a long time I‚Äôve exclusively used Google maps for searches and getting places. Unfortunately, the app seems to do what it wants instead of what you ask. Search by area means the whole state instead the exclusive location of your choosing. This has lost me appointments, jobs and an infinite amount of time, money and frustration! Even after choosing the location there is no guarantee, if there are others, that you will be directed to the destination chosen. Never mind picking the worst routes to get places when you know better. I‚Äôve deleted the app and in the process of deleting everything google because of this. Including email. I am over it!! Avoid this hijacking app and all affiliated at all costs! Apple‚Äôs maps app is much simpler but I‚Äôm actually glad I never threw away my atlases! Going back to using my brain. Thanks google

title: Shake to send feedback!
text: There is NO way to turn this off within the Google app. I‚Äôm not talking about in Google maps. People have been complaining about this for months and the only developer response I‚Äôve EVER seen is to go to another website to send more feedback. I know I‚Äôm not going to get any answers here, but I know people are searching for this exact question in the reviews to see if anyone has a remedy. So far the answer is no. No one seems to know how to disable this ‚Äúshake to send feedback‚Äù feature that pops up an absurd amount of times in a day. Why is Google collecting my unsolicited feedback without my approval 200x a day. Since they changed their privacy policies suddenly there‚Äôs a ‚Äúglitch‚Äù that totally invades my privacy without my consent. Because a permanent ‚Äúshake to send feedback‚Äù feature WAS NOT in the Google terms of agreement that I agreed to.

title: Hugely Politically biased
text: I‚Äôve looked up ‚Äúdonate to Trumps campaign‚Äù only to find a bunch of ‚Äúmud‚Äù on Trump. This is hugely unfair and undemocratic and just morally wrong. This is supposed to be the Information Age. Information and knowledge are supposed to be unbiased and without malignant ulterior motivation. So why is it so hard to find where to donate to Trumps campaign? The query was simple, straightforward, and obvious in what I wanted to find but the results I‚Äôm obviously looking for? Obscure. Search ‚Äúdonate to Bidens campaign‚Äù first result is a website where one can do so. Anyone that thinks big tech isn‚Äôt interfering with elections is an idiot. Anyone else that thinks they are and are fine with it is evil AND an idiot. The elite at the top keep growing in power and lording it over the rest of us. Sooner or later they‚Äôre going to start doing more and more things more and more people aren‚Äôt going to like. We must stop them now.

title: Doesn‚Äôt work half the time
text: I‚Äôve had this app for a few years and it‚Äôs happened intermittently, but it seems to have gotten worse recently. I‚Äôll search something and then just...... nothing. The screen will be and stay blank indefinitely, not loading a single result. Blue bar will fill up, but nothing shows up. I‚Äôve tried it on multiple different wifi networks, using data in various locations, force quit the app and restarted, to no avail. I‚Äôll then go search the same thing on the Safari app and it‚Äôll immediately load. So I‚Äôm inclined to think that it‚Äôs a problem with the app‚Äôs functionality, not user error. The next day or so it‚Äôll start functioning properly, only to go back to being broken again. It was convenient, but now it‚Äôs just infuriating

title: Fix the collections, please put them back on how they were!!
text: Can you guys separate the tabs and the collections and leave it how it was before, it‚Äôs annoying to go to your tabs and then swipe to the collections but the most Annoying part is that if you want to check your collections you have to click on ‚Äúview all collections‚Äù because if you don‚Äôt you‚Äôll only see the recent ones that are saved and will not show you the rest. Also when you click on one of the saved pages on your collections you have to go back click on ‚Äúview collections‚Äù and back to the same file you click on just to find what your looking for and is you miss click you have to redo everything again and again. It‚Äôs annoying please fix that, it‚Äôs getting to the point where I don‚Äôt want to rely on google anymore.

title: Slow and laggy typing
text:
I have been using this app for the last 2 years almost everyday. But since the last few updates in September/October 2019 the app has been laggy and slow. I‚Äôm typing faster than the app can recognize. It takes it a few seconds before the text shows what I have actually typed into the search bar. I know it‚Äôs not just my phone being slow because I am able to write this review without the problem and text at my normal speed in iMessages and other apps with no issues. 

Additionally, the search results seem to take longer to appear. The app hangs and freezes from time to time. Websites are opening slowly, and stay blank for a while before opening or not at all. When I‚Äôm scrolling down a page it does not scroll smoothly, rather there are pauses and it lags behind. I thought the most recent update would fix the problem but it hasn‚Äôt. 

The actual search content wise is good but there are too many ‚Äúrelated searches‚Äù and ‚Äúrelated search results‚Äù displayed and not enough actual results displayed on the small screen. It usually shows about 10-12 results, and then a list of 8 related searches and results for potential searches. That ratio is too close and there should be more actual search results. 

Please fix this.

title: Fix History and Images
text: The way you delete and look at your search history along with Google images has recently been updated, and it needs to go back. First off, the best feature of your Search History, the ability to delete all of it at once, has been removed and replaced with a day by day basis which is much more difficult to manage. Also, the way you view images when you search has been changed and looks atrocious. It‚Äôs clunky, and you can no longer look at images in full screen. It appears to be a terrible attempt at trying to make it look like the desktop image search. Please, please, bring back the old History and Images search, as they are superior and easier to use than what has been added.

title: Could be an amazing app but...
text: I really like this app, but lately I have been pretty frustrated with it. This wasn‚Äôt happening at first, but now when I open the recently visited websites tab after I‚Äôve been using the app to try and navigate to another page it won‚Äôt go to the page I want. It is happening fairly often too. It‚Äôs not that big of a deal, because I can get there by either typing it into the address bar or closing out of and restarting the app (sometimes this doesn‚Äôt work though). But it‚Äôs a real pain and can prevent me from setting aside a page or make me lose my progress on something like it just recently did. The mishap is actually what prompted me to write this review. If this problem were to go away the app would get a full 5 stars from me.

title: Pages often refresh in the middle of me reading them
text:
I use the Google app exclusively as a source for content. Eg. I open it, scroll through articles, and select ones I want to read. For months now, a good portion of those articles will refresh themselves while I‚Äôm partway through bringing me back to the top again. Doesn‚Äôt happen all the time, even on a site where it‚Äôs happened before but it does happen on more than one site. I‚Äôm betting it has something to do with all the ads on the sites as they are usually ones like ScreenRant or MovieWeb but I don‚Äôt have the same issues with Safari or Edge. This is on iOS (whatever latest is as of this writing).

Without this issue, I quite enjoy the app as a quick diversion.

title: Craig at Sentinel Pest
text: Craig is great and always checks in the day before he is coming with a call, he also checks with us when he arrives.  He is very responsive to our questions and concerns about the wild life we have around our home that we don‚Äôt want to be affected negatively by the pest chemicals.  We need to keep them out of the house and he is good about making sure that happens.  I would highly recommend Sentinel for your pest control needs.  They allow us to skip months if we don‚Äôt feel we need them and are not as expensive as some companies.  Craig has been our Representative for over 3 years.

title: News feed is so bad it's surreal
text:
For the longest time, I really enjoyed this app as a combination Google search bar and customized news feed. And for a while it was great! It reminded me of Google's discontinued iGoogle homepage. But something significant changed not long ago and the news feed is basically just random trash that I've never told Google I'm interested in. In fact, no matter how many times I tell the app I'm not interested in a topic or person or source or whatever, it just continues to show me more. It's laughable what it decides I'm going to want to see. 

Disappointing, because it used to be a regular piece of my news perusal. Now it's worthless and no amount of interaction seems to help the "algorithm" figure out what I wanna see. 

Come on, Google. You own so much data on me already that you should be able to figure me out. Especially with my help.

title: Swipe keyboard
text:
The reason I have this app is for the swipe keyboard. This may be the single greatest feature of this app, as my major complaint about iPhones has always been the lack of one. However, since the latest update (11.2.1), there has been quite a lag between me finishing a word and it being entered onto the screen. If I type too fast, words sometimes won't get displayed as they get"typed over."  This is extremely frustrating and completely ruins the point of swipe (fast texting), and therefore, the app (in my particular case). It may be an Apple issue, since it has only been happening since the most recent update, but there may be something you guys can do about it. This is a 5 star app, but since the update has been a 2 star app. Please fix this issue. 

(I have an iPhone SE if that matters at all)

Thanks

title: What happened
text:
Google has been the word that changed social media as well as the internet almost as soon as Google hit the internet. We no longer just "browsed" the internet or "searched", we now "googled" and soon just about everyone knew exactly what we were talking about.  To google became the very personification of searching for info on the internet.

Not sure what happened but I just deleted google as it has gone wonky. At first I thought it was just my iPad but when all the other apps are working as well as they ever did...except for google, it had to be the app, or google.  Can't give it five stars as a result.  It seems even google has issues. Just doesn't seem as reliable as before.

title: Pizza
text: What a joke. I watched the Wawa pizza commercial on TV, so I decided to give it a try. First I asked about pizza while I was getting coffee and a breakfast sandwich at the Hamilton Ave location, figuring that I would get one later in the day. The person who waited on me was a little unsure about prices and toppings, she did tell me they can not take pizza orders before 4pm because their system would not allow it. So dinner time rolls around and I now go to the rte 100 Upper Macungie location. These people told me I could only get a personal pizza because they did not have the equipment to make a full size pie and many locations don‚Äôt. I ordered 2 personal size pies and they were white on the bottom and not very good. I‚Äôm sticking with my usual pizzeria. Great Wawa commercial, terrible product. Stick with coffee, sandwiches and gas, leave the pizza to the pros. Very disappointing and zero star rating.

title: A Must-Have Search App: 5 Stars for Functionality and Fluidity
text: I absolutely love this app! The functionalities are top-notch and it runs so smoothly. I can easily navigate through different sections and find what I need without any trouble. The design is sleek and user-friendly. My only suggestion for improvement would be to make the app a default search browser option on iPhone. Currently, I can only set Chrome as my default browser, but I prefer using this app for my searches. Overall, a fantastic experience and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable and efficient search app.

title: Only works half the time
text: I used to really enjoy this app, I‚Äôve been using it for a few years now. Now it seems like ads are the priority, not content. Annoying ads are the first to load, content comes second. What prompted me to write this review was when I was trying to finish an article, the content repeatedly disappeared on the page, the ads stayed in place of course, causing me to constantly refresh. The load/refresh rate is always slow, even on a fast connection. Not to mention I get pop-ups that take over my screen on a regular basis. Is this how Google treats its users? Not to mention the biased search results and cards. I consider myself a moderate, but the mentioned items are always politically skewed. How about some variety Google? Stop treating your users as statistics and data mines. Fix these issues.

title: Could use a better hi
text:
I‚Äôm a fan of google and all it offers but i much prefer google news ui and gategories setup to this search app I believe that this app could use a better gategory selection as well as the non existent sub category like on the actual website google news app is awesome but buggy and has everything i want this app is just the google news with out the ability to easily select options no bells or whistles hardly and it is frustrating to
Navigate especially when you reach the end after clicking more it is lacking but not buggy like google news

title: Fatal Flaw
text:
The app is fine‚Äîit‚Äôs Google and Google has a lot of helpful products.  It‚Äôs intuitive, yada yada yada. 

The problem is that when you open the app and want to start typing, there is at least a one second delay before it lets you click into the search bar...  other browser apps allow you to start typing immediately and presumably just load other stuff while you are typing your search.  Not sure why Google can‚Äôt figure this one out...

The other issue is that Google‚Äôs search algorithms produce liberal-biased results. If you don‚Äôt believe me just do some search comparisons using Google and Yahoo.  I knew Google was a liberal company but it‚Äôs unacceptable that it permeates  into OUR web searches.
